medcomp:
Composition : 
Chromium, Copper, Folic Acid, Maganese, Selenium, Vitamin A, Vitamin B12, Vitamin B6, Vitamin C, Vitamin E, Zinc
productintro:
PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
When is Cardio Plus Capsule Prescribed ?
•	 Acne
•	 Aids
•	 Age Related Vision Loss
efffects:
side effects of Cardio Plus Capsule
•	 Allergic Rejection
•	 Abdominal Cramps
•	 Acute Toxicity
•	 Allergic Reaction
safety:
SAFETY ADVICE
Alcohol:
It is generally advisable to avoid or limit alcohol consumption while taking medications like Cardio Plus. Alcohol can interact with certain components of cardiac medications, potentially leading to adverse effects or diminishing the efficacy of the medicine. Always consult your healthcare provider for specific advice.
Pregnancy:
The safety of Cardio Plus during pregnancy depends on its specific ingredients. Some cardiovascular medications can be harmful to a developing fetus. It's crucial to inform your healthcare provider if you are pregnant or planning to become pregnant. They can evaluate the risks and benefits, potentially offering alternative treatments that are safer during pregnancy.
Breastfeeding:
Similar to pregnancy, the safety of Cardio Plus during breastfeeding depends on its ingredients. Some medications can pass into breast milk and may affect a nursing infant. Consult your healthcare provider to determine whether you should continue the medication while breastfeeding or if an alternative treatment is recommended.
Driving:
Some cardiovascular medications may cause side effects such as dizziness, fatigue, or blurred vision, which can impair your ability to drive or operate machinery safely. If you experience these symptoms, avoid driving and consult your healthcare provider for further advice.
Liver:
Patients with liver conditions should use Cardio Plus with caution. Liver impairment can affect the metabolism and clearance of medications, leading to increased risk of side effects. Your healthcare provider might need to adjust your dosage or monitor your liver function regularly.
Kidney:
Kidney function can also impact the clearance of medications. Patients with kidney issues should inform their healthcare provider, as they may need dosage adjustments or additional monitoring to prevent potential toxicity or reduced efficacy.

productintro:
PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
Dolo 650 Tablet helps relieve pain and fever by blocking the release of certain chemical messengers responsible for fever and pain. It is used to treat headaches, migraine, toothaches, sore throats, period (menstrual) pains, arthritis, muscle aches, and the common cold.
efffects:
Common side effects of Dolo 650 Tablet
•	Stomach pain
•	Nausea
•	Vomiting
safety:
SAFETY ADVICE OF DOLO 650 TABLET
Alcohol: It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Dolo 650 Tablet.

Pregnancy: Dolo 650 Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor.

Breast feeding: Dolo 650 Tablet is safe to use during breastfeeding. Human studies suggest that the drug does not pass into the breastmilk in a significant amount and is not harmful to the baby.

Driving: Dolo 650 Tablet does not usually affect your ability to drive.

Kidney: Dolo 650 Tablet should be used with caution in patients with kidney disease. Dose adjustment of Dolo 650 Tablet may be needed. Please consult your doctor.
However, Dolo 650 Tablet contains paracetamol which is considered the safest painkiller for kidney disease patients.

Liver: Dolo 650 Tablet should be used with caution in patients with liver disease. Dose adjustment of Dolo 650 Tablet may be needed. Please consult your doctor.
However, the use of Dolo 650 Tablet is not recommended in patients with severe liver disease and active liver disease.

productintro:
PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
Flexon MR Tablet is a combination medicine used in the treatment of pain due to muscle spasm. It improves the movement of muscles and provides relief from pain and discomfort associated with muscle spasms.
efffects:
Common side effects of Flexon MR
•	Nausea
•	Indigestion
•	Stomach pain
•	Weakness
•	Dizziness
•	Sleepiness
•	Heartburn
safety:
SAFETY ADVICE
Alcohol: It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Flexon MR Tablet.

Pregnancy: Flexon MR Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor.

Breast feeding: Information regarding the use of Flexon MR Tablet during breastfeeding is not available. Please consult your doctor.

Driving: Flexon MR Tablet may cause side effects which could affect your ability to drive.

Kidney: Flexon MR Tablet should be used with caution in patients with kidney disease. Dose adjustment of Flexon MR Tablet may be needed. Please consult your doctor.
Use of Flexon MR Tablet is not recommended in patients with severe kidney disease. Long term use of this medicine can affect the kidney function.

Liver: Flexon MR Tablet should be used with caution in patients with liver disease. Dose adjustment of Flexon MR Tablet may be needed. Please consult your doctor.
However, the use of Flexon MR Tablet is not recommended in patients with severe liver disease and active liver disease.

productintro:
PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
Indclav 625 Tablet is an antibiotic that helps your body fight infections caused by bacteria. It is used to treat infections of the lungs (e.g., pneumonia), ear, nasal sinus, urinary tract, skin, and soft tissue. It will not work for viral infections such as the common cold.
efffects:
Common side effects of Indclav
•	Mucocutaneous candidiasis
•	Vomiting
•	Nausea
•	Diarrhea
safety:
SAFETY ADVICE
Alcohol: Consuming alcohol with Indclav 625 Tablet does not cause any harmful side effects.

Pregnancy: Indclav 625 Tablet is generally considered safe to use during pregnancy. Animal studies have shown low or no adverse effects to the developing baby; however, there are limited human studies.

Breast feeding: Indclav 625 Tablet is safe to use during breastfeeding. Human studies suggest that the drug does not pass into the breastmilk in a significant amount and is not harmful to the baby.

Driving: Indclav 625 Tablet may cause side effects which could affect your ability to drive.
Indclav 625 Tablet may cause side effects such as allergic reactions, dizziness or fits that may make you unfit to drive.

Kidney: Indclav 625 Tablet should be used with caution in patients with kidney disease. Dose adjustment of Indclav 625 Tablet may be needed. Please consult your doctor.
Use of this medicine is not recommended in patients with severe kidney disease.

Liver: Indclav 625 Tablet should be used with caution in patients with liver disease. Dose adjustment of Indclav 625 Tablet may be needed. Please consult your doctor.
Regular monitoring of liver function tests is recommended while you are taking this medicine

productintro:
PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
 Lopox 2mg Tablet is used in the treatment of diarrhea. It should not be used in patients with dysentery (diarrhea with blood).
efffects:
Common side effects of Lopox
•	Constipation
•	Nausea
•	Headache
•	Stomach pain
safety:
SAFETY ADVICE
Alcohol: Lopox 2mg Tablet may cause excessive drowsiness with alcohol.

Pregnancy: Lopox 2mg Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor.

Breast feeding: Lopox 2mg Tablet is safe to use during breastfeeding. Human studies suggest that the drug does not pass into the breastmilk in a significant amount and is not harmful to the baby.

Driving: Lopox 2mg Tablet may decrease alertness, affect your vision or make you feel sleepy and dizzy. Do not drive if these symptoms occur.

Kidney: Lopox 2mg Tablet is safe to use in patients with kidney disease. No dose adjustment of Lopox 2mg Tablet is recommended.
However, inform your doctor if you have any underlying kidney disease.

Liver: Lopox 2mg Tablet should be used with caution in patients with liver disease. Dose adjustment of Lopox 2mg Tablet may be needed. Please consult your doctor.

productintro:
PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
Macbery LS Expectorant is a combination medicine used in the treatment of cough with mucus. It thins mucus in the nose, windpipe, and lungs, making it easier to cough out. It also provides relief from runny nose, sneezing, itching, and watery eyes.
efffects:
Common side effects of Macbery LS
•	Nausea
•	Vomiting
•	Diarrhea
•	Upset stomach
•	Stomach pain
•	Allergic reaction
•	Dizziness
•	Headache
•	Rash
•	Hives
•	Tremors
•	Palpitations
•	Muscle cramp
•	Increased heart rate
safety:
SAFETY ADVICE
Alcohol: It is not known whether it is safe to consume alcohol with Macbery LS Expectorant. Please consult your doctor.

Pregnancy: Macbery LS Expectorant may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor.

Breast feeding: Information regarding the use of Macbery LS Expectorant during breastfeeding is not available. Please consult your doctor.

Driving: Macbery LS Expectorant may decrease alertness, affect your vision or make you feel sleepy and dizzy. Do not drive if these symptoms occur.

Kidney: Macbery LS Expectorant should be used with caution in patients with kidney disease. Dose adjustment of Macbery LS Expectorant may be needed. Please consult your doctor.
Limited information is available on the use of Macbery LS Expectorant in these patients.

Liver: Macbery LS Expectorant should be used with caution in patients with liver disease. Dose adjustment of Macbery LS Expectorant may be needed. Please consult your doctor.
Limited information is available on the use of Macbery LS Expectorant in these patients.

productintro:
PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
Meftal-Spas Tablet is a prescription medicine that helps to provide symptomatic relief from menstrual (period-related) pain and cramps. It is also used to treat abdominal pain by relieving spasms of the muscles in the stomach and intestines.

productintro:
PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
Nervijen-NP Tablet is a combination medicine used to treat neuropathic pain. It works by decreasing pain by controlling calcium channel activity of the nerve cells. It also increases the level of chemical messengers in the brain that help in regulating the mood and protect nerve fibers.
efffects:
Common side effects of Nervijen-NP
•	Orthostatic hypotension (sudden lowering of blood pressure on standing)
•	Increased heart rate
•	Difficulty in urination
•	Decreased appetite
•	Nausea
•	Vomiting
•	Constipation
•	Weight gain
•	Dizziness
•	Sleepiness
•	Tiredness
•	Blurred vision
•	Dryness in mouth
•	Uncoordinated body movements
•	Diarrhea
•	Headache
safety:
SAFETY ADVICE
Alcohol: Nervijen-NP Tablet may cause excessive drowsiness with alcohol.

Pregnancy: Nervijen-NP Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor.

Breast feeding: Nervijen-NP Tablet is probably unsafe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug may pass into the breastmilk and harm the baby.

Driving: Nervijen-NP Tablet may cause side effects which could affect your ability to drive.
As Nervijen-NP Tablet may affect your alertness which may affect your ability to drive.

Kidney: Nervijen-NP Tablet should be used with caution in patients with kidney disease. Dose adjustment of Nervijen-NP Tablet may be needed. Please consult your doctor.

Liver: Nervijen-NP Tablet is probably safe to use in patients with liver disease. Limited data available suggests that dose adjustment of Nervijen-NP Tablet may not be needed in these patients. Please consult your doctor.

Benfotiamine (7.5mg) + Folic Acid (0.75mg) + Methylcobalamin (750mcg) + Pregabalin (75mg) + Vitamin B6 (Pyridoxine) (1.5mg)
productintro:
PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
Nervijen-P Capsule is a prescription medicine that helps relieve neuropathic pain (pain from damaged nerves). It strengthens the nerves and relieves nerve pain.
efffects:
Common side effects of Nervijen-P
•	Dizziness
•	Sleepiness
•	Tiredness
•	Uncoordinated body movements
safety:
SAFETY ADVICE
Alcohol: Caution is advised when consuming alcohol with Nervijen-P Capsule. Please consult your doctor.

Pregnancy: Nervijen-P Capsule may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor.

Breast feeding: Nervijen-P Capsule is probably unsafe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug may pass into the breastmilk and harm the baby.

Driving: Nervijen-P Capsule may decrease alertness, affect your vision or make you feel sleepy and dizzy. Do not drive if these symptoms occur.

Kidney: Nervijen-P Capsule is probably safe to use in patients with kidney disease. Limited data available suggests that dose adjustment of Nervijen-P Capsule may not be needed in these patients. Please consult your doctor.

Liver: Nervijen-P Capsule is probably safe to use in patients with liver disease. Limited data available suggests that dose adjustment of Nervijen-P Capsule may not be needed in these patients. Please consult your doctor.

medcomp:
COMPOSITION
•	Mecobalamin J.P.
•	Alpha Lipoic Acid U.S.P.
•	Benfothiamine
•	Pyridoxine Hydrochloride (B6) I.P.
•	Nicotinamide (B3) I.P.
•	Folic Acid I.P.
productintro:
PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
Benfotiamine increases transketolase activity, that can in turn decreases the buildup of detrimental glucose metabolites that can lead to advanced glycation end products (AGE), which may lead to diabetic complications. Benfotiamine also prevents diabetic retinopathy. 
Benfotiamine and alpha-lipoic acid should be considered as first choices among pathogenetically oriented treatments of diabetic neuropathy.
Methylcobalamin is an essential nutrient for neurons and Alpha Lipoic Acid is a powerful antioxidant that protects the neurons from oxidative stress.
Inositol reduces blood sugar levels and helps in healing the nerve damage as well.
 
Nervijen Plus Capsule is recommended in Diabetic Neuropathy, Diabetic Nephropathy, Diabetic retinopathy, CVD and Alcoholic Neuropathy
efffects:
Common Side Effects:
 Gastrointestinal Issues:  Nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and abdominal pain.
Neurological Symptoms: Dizziness, headache, and sometimes numbness or tingling.
Allergic Reactions: Rash, itching, or swelling, particularly of the face, tongue, or throat.
General Symptoms: Fatigue or weakness.
safety:
SAFETY ADVICE:
Alcohol: Alcohol can exacerbate some side effects of Nervijen-Plus, such as dizziness and gastrointestinal issues. It's best to limit or avoid alcohol consumption while taking this medication. Consult your healthcare provider for personalized advice.
Pregnancy: The safety of Nervijen-Plus during pregnancy is not well-established. Pregnant women should only use it if clearly needed and prescribed by a healthcare provider. Always inform your healthcare provider if you are pregnant or planning to become pregnant while on this medication.
Breastfeeding: It is unclear if the ingredients in Nervijen-Plus pass into breast milk. Nursing mothers should consult their healthcare provider before using this medication to weigh the potential benefits and risks to the infant.
Driving: Nervijen-Plus can cause dizziness and fatigue, which may impair your ability to drive or operate machinery. If you experience these side effects, avoid driving and consult your healthcare provider.
Liver: Patients with liver conditions should use Nervijen-Plus with caution. Liver dysfunction can affect the metabolism of the medication, leading to increased risk of side effects. Your healthcare provider may need to adjust your dosage or monitor your liver function regularly.
Kidney: Kidney impairment can affect the excretion of Nervijen-Plus, potentially leading to toxicity. Inform your healthcare provider if you have kidney issues, as they may need to adjust your dosage or provide additional monitoring.

medcomp:
COMPOSITION
Paracetamol (also known as acetaminophen),starch, povidone, and magnesium stearate.
productintro:
PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
Pacimol, containing paracetamol, is widely used for its analgesic (pain-relieving) and antipyretic (fever-reducing) properties. It was first introduced in the mid-20th century and has become one of the most commonly used medications globally due to its efficacy and safety profile when used appropriately.
efffects:
Common Side Effects:

Gastrointestinal Issues: Nausea, vomiting, and abdominal pain.
Allergic Reactions: Rash, itching, and swelling, particularly of the face, tongue, or throat.
Hepatotoxicity: In rare cases, especially with overdose, it can cause severe liver damage.
safety:
SAFETY ADVICE:
Alcohol: Avoid alcohol consumption while taking Pacimol, as both substances are metabolized by the liver. Combining them can increase the risk of liver damage.
Pregnancy: Paracetamol is generally considered safe during pregnancy for short-term use. However, it should be used at the lowest effective dose for the shortest possible time. Always consult your healthcare provider before taking any medication during pregnancy.
Breastfeeding: Paracetamol is considered safe for use during breastfeeding, as only small amounts pass into breast milk and it has not been shown to harm nursing infants. Nonetheless, it's wise to consult your healthcare provider.
Driving: Pacimol does not usually cause dizziness or drowsiness, so it is generally safe to drive or operate machinery while taking it. However, if you experience any unusual symptoms, avoid such activities and consult your healthcare provider.
Liver: Patients with liver conditions should use Pacimol with caution. The maximum recommended dose should not be exceeded, and prolonged use should be avoided. Regular monitoring of liver function may be necessary.
Kidney: While paracetamol is primarily metabolized by the liver, patients with severe kidney impairment should use it with caution and may require dosage adjustments. Consult your healthcare provider for specific recommendations.

productintro:
PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
Pacimol MF Oral Suspension is a combination of two medicines. It is used in the treatment of fever. It is also useful for the treatment of mild to moderate pain of various conditions like headache, body ache, and toothache.
efffects:
Common side effects of Pacimol MF
•	Nausea
•	Vomiting
•	Diarrhea
•	Indigestion
•	Loss of appetite
•	Heartburn
safety:
SAFETY ADVICE
Alcohol: It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Pacimol MF Oral Suspension.

Pregnancy: Pacimol MF Oral Suspension may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor.

Breast feeding: Pacimol MF Oral Suspension is safe to use during breastfeeding. Human studies suggest that the drug does not pass into the breastmilk in a significant amount and is not harmful to the baby.

Driving: Pacimol MF Oral Suspension may decrease alertness, affect your vision or make you feel sleepy and dizzy. Do not drive if these symptoms occur.

Kidney: Pacimol MF Oral Suspension should be used with caution in patients with kidney disease. Dose adjustment of Pacimol MF Oral Suspension may be needed. Please consult your doctor.
Use of Pacimol MF Oral Suspension is not recommended in patients with severe kidney disease.

Liver: Pacimol MF Oral Suspension should be used with caution in patients with liver disease. Dose adjustment of Pacimol MF Oral Suspension may be needed. Please consult your doctor.
However, the use of Pacimol MF Oral Suspension is not recommended in patients with severe liver disease and active liver disease.

productintro:
PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
Revelol-AM 50/5 Tablet PR contains two medicines, both of which help to control high blood pressure and heart rate. It is also used for heart-related chest pain (angina), abnormal heart rhythms and chronic (long-term) heart failure.
efffects:
Common side effects of Revelol-AM
•	Nausea
•	Slow heart rate
•	Abdominal pain
•	Dizziness
•	Fatigue
•	Sleepiness
•	Depression
•	Ankle swelling
•	Constipation
•	Edema (swelling)
•	Flushing (sense of warmth in the face, ears, neck and trunk)
•	Palpitations
•	Headache
•	Vomiting
•	Visual disturbance
•	Orthostatic hypotension (sudden lowering of blood pressure on standing)
•	Breathlessness
•	Muscle cramp
•	Skin rash
safety:
SAFETY ADVICE
Alcohol: It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Revelol-AM 50/5 Tablet PR.

Pregnancy: Revelol-AM 50/5 Tablet PR may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor.

Breast feeding: Revelol-AM 50/5 Tablet PR is probably unsafe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug may pass into the breastmilk and harm the baby.

Driving: Revelol-AM 50/5 Tablet PR may cause side effects which could affect your ability to drive.
Revelol-AM 50/5 Tablet PR may cause side effects such as dizziness, headaches, nausea or tiredness, all of which could affect your ability to concentrate and drive.

Kidney: Revelol-AM 50/5 Tablet PR is safe to use in patients with kidney disease. No dose adjustment of Revelol-AM 50/5 Tablet PR is recommended.

Liver: Revelol-AM 50/5 Tablet PR should be used with caution in patients with liver disease. Dose adjustment of Revelol-AM 50/5 Tablet PR may be needed. Please consult your doctor.

productintro:
PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
Revelol XL 50 Tablet belongs to a group of medicines called beta-blockers. It is used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension), angina (heart-related chest pain), and irregular heart rhythms (arrhythmia). It also helps to prevent migraines, future heart attacks, and stroke.
efffects:
Common side effects of Revelol
•	Fatigue
•	Headache
•	Slow heart rate
•	Dizziness
•	Nausea
•	Breathlessness
•	Rash
•	Diarrhea
•	Depression
safety:
SAFETY ADVICE
Alcohol: It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Revelol XL 50 Tablet.

Pregnancy: Revelol XL 50 Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor.

Breast feeding: Revelol XL 50 Tablet is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug does not represent any significant risk to the baby.

Driving: Revelol XL 50 Tablet may decrease alertness, affect your vision or make you feel sleepy and dizzy. Do not drive if these symptoms occur.

Kidney: Revelol XL 50 Tablet is safe to use in patients with kidney disease. No dose adjustment of Revelol XL 50 Tablet is recommended.

Liver: Revelol XL 50 Tablet should be used with caution in patients with liver disease. Dose adjustment of Revelol XL 50 Tablet may be needed. Please consult your doctor.

productintro:
PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
Solvin Cold Tablet is a medicine used in the treatment of common cold symptoms. It provides relief from symptoms such as headache, sore throat, runny nose, muscular pain, and fever.
efffects:
Common side effects of Solvin Cold
•	Nausea
•	Headache
•	Insomnia (difficulty in sleeping)
•	Dizziness
•	Tachycardia
•	Palpitations
•	Fear
•	Anxiety
•	Restlessness
•	Tremors
•	Weakness
•	Discomfort when urinating
•	Hallucination
•	Convulsion
safety:
SAFETY ADVICE

Pregnancy: Solvin Cold Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor.

Breast feeding: Solvin Cold Tablet is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug does not represent any significant risk to the baby.

Driving: Solvin Cold Tablet may decrease alertness, affect your vision or make you feel sleepy and dizzy. Do not drive if these symptoms occur.

Kidney: Solvin Cold Tablet is probably safe to use in patients with kidney disease. Limited data available suggests that dose adjustment of Solvin Cold Tablet may not be needed in these patients. Please consult your doctor.
Use of Solvin Cold Tablet may cause excessive sleepiness in patients with end stage kidney disease.

Liver: Solvin Cold Tablet should be used with caution in patients with liver disease. Dose adjustment of Solvin Cold Tablet may be needed. Please consult your doctor.

productintro:
PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
Tel-Revelol 40/50 Tablet ER is a medicine used for treating high blood pressure. By lowering blood pressure, it helps in preventing future heart attacks and strokes. Early treatment with this medicine also improves the chances of survival in patients with heart attacks.
efffects:
Common side effects of Tel-Revelol
•	Headache
•	Weakness
•	Dizziness
•	Cold extremities
•	Slow heart rate
•	Increased potassium level in blood
•	Decreased blood pressure
•	Orthostatic hypotension (sudden lowering of blood pressure on standing)
•	Breathlessness
•	Vomiting
•	Abdominal pain
safety:
SAFETY ADVICE
Alcohol: It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Tel-Revelol 40/50 Tablet ER.

Pregnancy: Tel-Revelol 40/50 Tablet ER is unsafe to use during pregnancy as there is definite evidence of risk to the developing baby. However, the doctor may rarely prescribe it in some life-threatening situations if the benefits are more than the potential risks. Please consult your doctor.

Breast feeding: Tel-Revelol 40/50 Tablet ER is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug does not represent any significant risk to the baby.

Driving: Tel-Revelol 40/50 Tablet ER may decrease alertness, affect your vision or make you feel sleepy and dizzy. Do not drive if these symptoms occur.

Kidney: Tel-Revelol 40/50 Tablet ER is safe to use in patients with kidney disease. No dose adjustment of Tel-Revelol 40/50 Tablet ER is recommended.

Liver: Tel-Revelol 40/50 Tablet ER should be used with caution in patients with liver disease. Dose adjustment of Tel-Revelol 40/50 Tablet ER may be needed. Please consult your doctor.

productintro:
PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
Telvas 20 Tablet is a medicine used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure. Lowering blood pressure helps to prevent future heart attacks and strokes. This medicine is also effective in preserving kidney function in patients with diabetes
efffects:
Common side effects of Telvas
•	Upper respiratory tract infection
•	Back pain
•	Diarrhea
•	Sinus inflammation
•	Skin ulcer
•	Intermittent claudication
safety:
SAFETY ADVICE
Alcohol: It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Telvas 20 Tablet.

Pregnancy: Telvas 20 Tablet is unsafe to use during pregnancy as there is definite evidence of risk to the developing baby. However, the doctor may rarely prescribe it in some life-threatening situations if the benefits are more than the potential risks. Please consult your doctor.

Breast feeding: Information regarding the use of Telvas 20 Tablet during breastfeeding is not available. Please consult your doctor.

Driving: Telvas 20 Tablet may decrease alertness, affect your vision or make you feel sleepy and dizzy. Do not drive if these symptoms occur.

Kidney: Telvas 20 Tablet should be used with caution in patients with severe kidney disease. Dose adjustment of Telvas 20 Tablet may be needed. Please consult your doctor.
However, inform your doctor if you have an underlying kidney disease. Regular monitoring of blood pressure, creatinine, and potassium levels may be advised while you are taking this medicine.

Liver: Telvas 20 Tablet should be used with caution in patients with liver disease. Dose adjustment of Telvas 20 Tablet may be needed. Please consult your doctor.
Use of Telvas 20 Tablet is not recommended in patients with severe liver disease.

productintro:
PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
Zerodol P Tablet is a pain-relieving medicine. It is used to reduce pain and inflammation in conditions like rheumatoid arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, and osteoarthritis. It may also be used to relieve muscle pain, back pain, toothache, or pain in the ear and throat.
efffects:
Common side effects of Zerodol P
•	Nausea
•	Vomiting
•	Stomach pain/epigastric pain
•	Loss of appetite
•	Heartburn
•	Diarrhea
safety:
SAFETY ADVICE
Alcohol: It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Zerodol P Tablet.

Pregnancy: Zerodol P Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor.

Breast feeding: Information regarding the use of Zerodol P Tablet during breastfeeding is not available. Please consult your doctor.

Driving: Zerodol P Tablet may decrease alertness, affect your vision or make you feel sleepy and dizzy. Do not drive if these symptoms occur.

Kidney: Zerodol P Tablet should be used with caution in patients with kidney disease. Dose adjustment of Zerodol P Tablet may be needed. Please consult your doctor.
Use of Zerodol P Tablet is not recommended in patients with severe kidney disease.

Liver: Zerodol P Tablet should be used with caution in patients with liver disease. Dose adjustment of Zerodol P Tablet may be needed. Please consult your doctor.
However, the use of Zerodol P Tablet is not recommended in patients with severe liver disease and active liver disease.

productintro:
PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
Zerodol-SP Tablet is a combination medicine used to relieve pain and swelling in various conditions like muscle pain, joint pain, and postoperative pain. Thus, it effectively alleviates pain and inflammation in conditions like rheumatoid arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, and osteoarthritis.
efffects:
Common side effects of Zerodol-SP
•	Nausea
•	Vomiting
•	Stomach pain
•	Indigestion
•	Heartburn
•	Loss of appetite
•	Diarrhea
•	Dizziness
•	Increased liver enzymes
•	Drowsiness
safety:
SAFETY ADVICE
Alcohol: It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Zerodol-SP Tablet.

Pregnancy: Zerodol-SP Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor.

Breast feeding: Information regarding the use of Zerodol-SP Tablet during breastfeeding is not available. Please consult your doctor.

Driving: Zerodol-SP Tablet may decrease alertness, affect your vision or make you feel sleepy and dizzy. Do not drive if these symptoms occur.
 
Kidney: Zerodol-SP Tablet should be used with caution in patients with kidney disease. Dose adjustment of Zerodol-SP Tablet may be needed. Please consult your doctor.
Use of Zerodol-SP Tablet is not recommended in patients with severe kidney disease.

Liver: Zerodol-SP Tablet should be used with caution in patients with liver disease. Dose adjustment of Zerodol-SP Tablet may be needed. Please consult your doctor.
However, the use of Zerodol-SP Tablet is not recommended in patients with severe liver disease and active liver disease.

productintro:
PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
Zix-MR Tablet is a combination medicine used in the treatment of pain due to muscle spasms. It improves the movement of muscles and provides relief from pain and discomfort associated with muscle spasms.
efffects:
Common side effects of Zix-MR
•	Nausea
•	Vomiting
•	Heartburn
•	Stomach pain/epigastric pain
•	Loss of appetite
•	Diarrhea
safety:
SAFETY ADVICE
Alcohol: It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Zix-MR Tablet.

Pregnancy: Zix-MR Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor.

Breast feeding: Information regarding the use of Zix-MR Tablet during breastfeeding is not available. Please consult your doctor.
 
Driving: Zix-MR Tablet may cause side effects which could affect your ability to drive.

Kidney: Zix-MR Tablet should be used with caution in patients with kidney disease. Dose adjustment of Zix-MR Tablet may be needed. Please consult your doctor.
Use of Zix-MR Tablet is not recommended in patients with severe kidney disease.

Liver: Zix-MR Tablet should be used with caution in patients with liver disease. Dose adjustment of Zix-MR Tablet may be needed. Please consult your doctor.
Use of Zix-MR Tablet is not recommended in patients with severe liver disease. Regular monitoring of liver function tests is advisable while the patient is taking this medicine.

productintro:
PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
Zixflam Tablet is a pain relieving medicine. It is used to reduce pain and inflammation in conditions like rheumatoid arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, and osteoarthritis. It may also be used to relieve fever, muscle pain, back pain, toothache, or pain in the ear and throat.
efffects:
Common side effects of Zixflam
•	Nausea
•	Vomiting
•	Heartburn
•	Stomach pain
•	Indigestion
•	Loss of appetite
•	Diarrhea
safety:
SAFETY ADVICE
Alcohol: It is not known whether it is safe to consume alcohol with Zixflam Tablet. Please consult your doctor.

Pregnancy: Zixflam Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor.

Breast feeding: Information regarding the use of Zixflam Tablet during breastfeeding is not available. Please consult your doctor.

Driving: Zixflam Tablet may decrease alertness, affect your vision or make you feel sleepy and dizzy. Do not drive if these symptoms occur.

Kidney: Zixflam Tablet is probably safe to use in patients with kidney disease. Limited data available suggests that dose adjustment of Zixflam Tablet may not be needed in these patients. Please consult your doctor.

Liver: Zixflam Tablet is probably safe to use in patients with liver disease. Limited data available suggests that dose adjustment of Zixflam Tablet may not be needed in these patients. Please consult your doctor.
